Articles.Content:
Hi guys, 

i need some help. 

I generated a euler angle "Guidance" (vector) with MATLAB. This guidance consist of 3 vectors. One Vector for each euler axis. These vector show the euler angles for a defined time step.

Is it possible to visualize this spacecraft rotation in kerbal ? 

Thanks for your Help

Edited September 25, 2018 by Ildon
You mean draw the eular angles in KSP itself? Or something else.

@Ildon KRPC offers a pretty flexible autopilot system. You could read that list from a file, translate between reference frames, and output the desired heading/rotation. It wouldn't be a "perfect" recreation, but enough to visualize the motion, if you build the craft properly, and tune the autopilot.

https://krpc.github.io/krpc/python/api/space-center/auto-pilot.html (Other languages than Python available)

https://krpc.github.io/krpc/tutorials/reference-frames.html
